page.title: 20The School.
page.content:
The Church of England school at Frieth built as a one room school in 1865, later in the 19th. century two further rooms added, all flint faced. The outside Victorian toilet block demolished 1985 to make room for a toilet and cloakroom block. A temporary double classroom block was added in 1973. The catchment area is contiguous with the area reviewed, the Turville area having been transfered in 1984 on the closure of its School. It caters for children 5-12 yrs. old.
CREDITS. Compiled by the children of Class 1 Frieth C.E.C. School. Headmaster - E.J. Carpenter. ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS. Frieth W.I.; Sister Christine Revd. Mother; Rev. K. Joyce Rector; Rev. P. Nicolson; Mrs.F.Eland (The Vinery); Mrs.T.Ryland(Dover Farm).
